SHORES.Definition: where the land meets a large body of water (e.g. lake, sea)

CREW.Definition: the group of people who work together, e.g. on a ship

BOILS.Definition: a painful, infected bump under the skin

LUMPS.Definition: a swollen area sticking out from your skin

BYSTANDERS.Definition: people standing nearby and watching (something happen)

PILED UP.Definition: placed on top of one another

SYMPTOMS.Definition: something that shows you are suffering from an illness

TRANSMITTED.Definition: passed from one place or person to another

WIDESPREAD.Definition: existing in many places at the same time

NOTARY.Definition: someone with legal power to sign documents, often a lawyer

PILE UP.Definition: placed on top of one another

SPREADING.Definition: moving fast from one place to another

OVERSTATE.Definition: say is more important than it is

PUTRID.Definition: dead and having a terrible smell

DECIMATE.Definition: kill in large numbers (technically kill one in ten)

PILGRIMS.Definition: people who make a journey for religious reasons

BACTERIUM.Definition: a very small living thing, singular of bacteria

NAUSEA.Definition: feeling that you are going to vomit

GROIN.Definition: the place where your legs meet your body

ARMPITS.Definition: the place under where your arms meet your body

SCRATCHED THEIR HEADS.Definition: if you scratch your head, you don't know what to do about something

PUNISHMENT.Definition: suffering caused as revenge for something done

SCAPEGOATS.Definition: people who are said to be responsible for something bad

BORE THE BRUNT.Definition: if you bear the brunt of something, you suffer the most from it

ROMA.Definition: a people originally from India, who move from place to place

LEPERS.Definition: someone who has leprosy (a serious disease of the skin)

BOTTOM UP.Definition: from the lower part of society, rather than being imposed from the top

RESORTING TO.Definition: doing something you don't want to do because there are no other better options

FLAGELLATION.Definition: hitting yourself with a whip (long piece of rope), often as a religious punishment

WHIPPING.Definition: hitting yourself with a whip (long piece of rope), often as a religious punishment

VEINS.Definition: the tube that carries blood to the heart

RUBBISH.Definition: food and goods that are no longer needed and are thrown away

ADOPTING.Definition: starting to do or use something

REVEALING.Definition: if clothes are revealing, they show more of your body than usual

IMMODEST.Definition: showing large amounts of your body

PRESUMABLY.Definition: used to suggest that you believe what you have said is true

CONTAGIOUS.Definition: easily spread, easily passed from one person to another

INFECTIOUS.Definition: containing a disease/infection that can be passed to another person

PILES.Definition: group of things that are placed on top of each other

SENSATIONALIST.Definition: presenting a story in an exaggerated way
